content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: SSSTRESC
      operator: equal_to
      value: DEAD
    - name: DTHFL
      operator: not_equal_to
      value: Y
Match Datasets:
  - Name: DM
    Keys:
      - USUBJID
Core:
  Id: CORE-000008
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: Raise an error when DTHFL not equal to "Y" and SS.SSSTRESC = "DEAD".
Outcome:
  Message: DTHFL is not "Y", when SS.SSSTRESC equals "DEAD"
  Output Variables:
    - DTHFL
    - SSSTRESC
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0132
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: 4.5.8[4. If the subject's survival status is "dead",
                  the Demographics (DM) variables DTHDTC and DTHFL must be appropriately
                  populated.]|6.3.11[For example, if a subject's survival status is
                  "DEAD", the date of death must be stored in DM and within a final
                  disposition record in DS.].
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: Accounting for Long-Term Follow-up|Assumption 1
                Section: 4.5.8|6.3.11
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - FINDINGS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - SS

json.Description: Raise an error when DTHFL not equal to "Y" and SS.SSSTRESC = "DEAD".

Outcome.Message: DTHFL is not "Y", when SS.SSSTRESC equals "DEAD"

Citations.Cited_Guidance: 4.5.8[4. If the subject's survival status is "dead", the Demographics (DM) variables DTHDTC and DTHFL must be appropriately populated.]|6.3.11[For example, if a subject's survival status is "DEAD", the date of death must be stored in DM and within a final disposition record in DS.].
